content: An Irish daughter had not been home for over 5 years. Upon her return, her Father cussed her. "Where have ye been all this time? Why did ye not write to us, not even a line? Why didn't ye call? Can ye not understand what ye put yer old Mother thru?" The girl, crying, replied, "Sniff, sniff....Dad....I became a prostitute..." "Ye what!!? Out of here, ye shameless harlot! Sinner! You're a disgrace to this Catholic family." "OK, Dad-- as ye wish. I just came back to give mum this luxurious fur coat, title deed to a ten bedroom mansion plus a $5 million savings certificate. For me little brother, this gold Rolex. And for ye Daddy, the sparkling new Mercedes limited edition convertible that's parked outside plus a membership to the country club........................ (takes a breath)............. and an invitation for ye all to spend New Years Eve on board my new yacht in the Riviera and... ..." "Now what was it ye said ye had become?" says Dad. Girl, crying again, "Sniff, sniff....a prostitute Daddy! Sniff, sniff." "Oh! Be Jesus! Ye scared me half to death, girl! I thought ye said a Protestant. Come here and give yer old Dad a hug."

Sinner! You're a disgrace to this Catholic family." "OK, Dad-- as ye wish. I just came back to give mum this luxurious fur coat, title deed to a ten bedroom mansion plus a $5 million savings certificate. For me little brother, this gold Rolex. And for ye Daddy, the sparkling new Mercedes limited edition convertible that's parked outside plus a membership to the country club........................ (takes a breath)............. and an invitation for ye all to spend New Years Eve on board my new yacht in the Riviera and... ..." "Now what was it ye said ye had become?" says Dad. Girl, crying again, "Sniff, sniff....a prostitute Daddy! Sniff, sniff." "Oh! Be Jesus! Ye scared me half to death, girl! I thought ye said a Protestant. Come here and give yer old Dad a hug."
title: A little religious humor to share

content: There was a beautiful young novitiate and she was returning from a shopping trip that had extended until the late evening hours. As she made her way through a less than savory section of the town, she was attacked and brutally assaulted by a ravenous beast of a man!! He got up and sneering vilely at her asked....SO!! WHAT are you going to tell all them holy Joe's now??!!! Wwell...I'm going to..sniffle...tell them a ravenous beast and poor excuse for a human being, attacked and violently assaulted me, raping me and stealing my dignity.....twice..... if you're not too tired!!
reply: There was a beautiful young novitiate and she was returning from a shopping trip that had extended until the late evening hours. As she made her way through a less than savory section of the town, she was attacked and brutally assaulted by a ravenous beast of a man!! He got up and sneering vilely at her asked....SO!! WHAT are you going to tell all them holy Joe's now??!!! Wwell...I'm going to..sniffle...tell them a ravenous beast and poor excuse for a human being, attacked and violently assaulted me, raping me and stealing my dignity.....twice..... if you're not too tired!!
title: A little religious humor to share

content: 'Twas very funny. It gets an 'A.' [Can you tell me what the purpose of the comma in this string was, if it's not too impolite of me to ask: "...human being, attacked...."]
reply: 'Twas very funny. It gets an 'A.' [Can you tell me what the purpose of the comma in this string was, if it's not too impolite of me to ask: "...human being, attacked...."]
title: A little religious humor to share

content: I use comma's in the old style that the semi colon used to be used to indicate a break in the pattern of speach as one would pause to take a breath or to subtly emphasise a point or object of the sentence, in this case the drawing of breath AND the consideration of just WHAT to call her "attacker" when she was considering him in, shall we say, a slightly different light! example; And, the consideration of her attacker, when she was shall we say, considering him in a slightly different, "light". You can see how it changes the emphasis and therefor the thrust, of the sentence. To simplify, think of it as writing in the way people speak, not as one would when writing a technical treatise or some such. The tendency now a days is to write in short declarative sentences as the average reader is not as good at reading and retention as our generation is, so the style of narrative has changed considerably. Read some early Stephan King and some of what he has written lately. Some used to castigate Heinlien for his rambling sentences, with out realising that he was writing as people speak and THAT's what made it palatable for the average teenage reader like you and I were, when we started reading his stuff in H.S.!! CONSIDER the last paragraph. Some used to upbraid Heilein for his rambling sentences. They did not take into account an important point. He was writing as people speak. This made it more palatable for the readers of those times. We in our youth savored the written word as we learned to communicate. Today it is almost considered an impediment to take the time to read. Many see the tape or c.d. as the way to absorb information. Reading to you and I however is much more than simply absorbing information. When we read we are ACTIVE in our participation. Not merely spectators of the drama! That is how I would write if I was presenting it for a letter to an editor, or for publication. Short declarative sentences. I can write either way, but prefer to do as I do to personalise it for the fora and such as my blog. This message has been edited. Last edited by: tawodi, Thu 09 April 2009 06:29 AM
